cooking_method: 1. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Stir-fry chicken until cooked through. 3. Remove chicken and stir-fry peanuts, chili peppers, and ginger. 4. Add chicken back to the pan and stir-fry with the other ingredients. 5. Serve over rice.

1. Cut beef into thin slices and marinate with soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Blanch broccoli in boiling water. 3. Stir-fry garlic and beef until browned. 4. Add broccoli and stir-fry for another minute. 5. Serve over rice.

1. Cut tofu, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms into small pieces. 2. Beat eggs in a bowl. 3. Boil chicken stock and add the tofu, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms. 4. Add cornstarch and water mixture to thicken the soup. 5. Pour beaten eggs into the soup while stirring. 6. Add rice vinegar and serve hot.
1. Brown pork in a wok with garlic and doubanjiang. 2. Add tofu, chicken broth, and Sichuan peppercorns. 3. Thicken sauce with cornstarch. 4. Garnish with green onions. 5. Serve with rice.

ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Soy sauce and grated daikon for serving
cooking_method:
1. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. 
2. Gradually whisk in the ice-cold water until the batter is smooth. 
3. Heat the oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 375Â°F. 
4. Dip the shrimp in the batter, letting any excess batter drip off. 
5. Fry the shrimp in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. 
6. Drain on paper towels and serve with soy sauce and grated daikon.

ingredients: 1 sheet nori seaweed, cut into small pieces
cooking_method:
1. In a pot, bring the dashi or chicken broth to a simmer. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste with a ladleful of the hot broth until smooth. 
3. Add the miso mixture to the pot and stir to combine. 
4. Add the tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. 
5. Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with the green onions and nori seaweed.
